name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: So here are some specific examples of what

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: we can't do today and

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: part of speech tagging is still not easy to do 100% correctly.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: _So in the example
column6: he turned off the highway verses he turned off the fan and _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: the two offs actually have somewhat a differentness in their active

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: categories and also its very difficult to get a complete the parsing correct.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: _Again
column7: a man saw a boy with a telescope can actually _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: be very difficult to parse depending on the context.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: Precise deep semantic analysis is also very hard.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: _For example
column6: to define the meaning of own

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: _precisely is very difficult in the sentence

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: So the state of the off can be summarized as follows.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: Robust and

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: general NLP tends to be shallow while a deep understanding does not scale up.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: _For this reason in this course
column6: the techniques that we cover are in _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: _general
column6: shallow techniques for analyzing text data and _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: mining text data and they are generally based on statistical analysis.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: So there are robust and general and they are in

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: the in category of shallow analysis.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: So such techniques have the advantage of being able to be

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: applied to any text data in any natural about any topic.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: _But the downside is that
column6: they don't give use a deeper understanding of text. _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: _For that
column6: we have to rely on deeper natural language analysis. _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: That typically would require a human effort to annotate

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: a lot of examples of analysis that would like to do and then computers can use

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: machine learning techniques and learn from these training examples to do the task.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: _So in practical applications
column6: we generally combine the two kinds of techniques _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: with the general statistical and methods as a backbone as the basis.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: These can be applied to any text data.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: _And on top of that
column6: we're going to use humans to
column7: and you take more data and _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: _to use supervised machine learning to do some tasks as well as we can

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: especially for those important tasks to bring humans into the loop

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: to analyze text data more precisely.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: But this course will cover the general statistical approaches

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: _that generally

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: _So they're practically
column6: more useful that some of the deeper _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: analysis techniques that require a lot of human effort to annotate the text today.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: _So to summarize
column6: the main points we take are first NLP _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: is the foundation for text mining.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: _So obviously
column6: the better we can understand the text data

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: the better we can do text mining.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: Computers today are far from being able to understand the natural language.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: Deep NLP requires common sense knowledge and inferences.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: _Thus
column6: only working for very limited domains not feasible for _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: large scale text mining.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: Shallow NLP based on statistical methods can be done in large scale and

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: is the main topic of this course and

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: they are generally applicable to a lot of applications.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: _They are in some sense also

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: _In practice
column6: we use statistical NLP as the basis and _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Natural Language Content Analysis- Part 2 (00-04-25).srt
text: we'll have humans for help as needed in various ways.
